articles.author: NPR
articles.title: How prepared is the military's medical corps? : Consider This from NPR - NPR
articles.description:
When the U.S. launched its invasion of Afghanistan and Iraq in the early 2000s, it had been a decade since a full-scale deployment of American troops.

That's why when the wars started a lot of the medical corps' experience came from big city emergency…
articles.content:
United States Marines in Afghanistan carry colleague LCPL Jerome Hanley of Massachusetts, who was wounded in an insurgent attack to a waiting medevac helicopter in 2011.
Kevin Frayer/AP

articles.author: Tami Luhby
articles.title: Worried about affording air conditioning this summer? Share your story - CNN
articles.description: Americans will have to shell out $719 on electricity, on average, to keep their homes cool this summer, according to the National Energy Assistance Directors Association. That’s nearly $200 more than they paid in 2019.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Half of Americans think hush money verdict was correct, polling shows - MSNBC
articles.description: Half of Americans think the guilty verdict in former President Trump's hush money trial was correct, a new ABC News/Ipsos poll finds, and 49 percent think he should end his 2024 presidential campaign over the result. The Morning Joe panel discusses.
